entities.name: centaur
entities.description: The centaur is mentioned as part of a phrase 'THE CENTAUR AND THE SNEAK', indicating it's a specific entity being referred to.

entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is introduced as the one who says 'Enough of this rubbish!' and pulls out his own wand. This indicates he has a significant role in the scene.

entities.name: dawlish
entities.description: Dawlish is mentioned as someone Fudge orders to take Harry, indicating Dawlish's involvement in the action.

entities.name: shacklebolt
entities.description: Shacklebolt is also ordered by Fudge to take Harry, showing his role in the scene.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is introduced as someone who is being taken by Dawlish and Shacklebolt. He's also mentioned later when he struggles around to see who's half-strangling him.

entities.name: marietta
entities.description: Marietta is mentioned as someone McGonagall forces out of harm's way along with Harry. This indicates Marietta's presence in the scene.

entities.name: mcgonagall
entities.description: McGonagall is introduced as someone who forces both Harry and Marietta out of harm's way. She's also mentioned later when she's crouched beside Harry.

entities.name: fawkes
entities.description: Fawkes is mentioned as screeching in response to the commotion. This indicates Fawkes' presence and reaction to the scene.

entities.name: du st
entities.description: Du st is mentioned as a dark figure that falls to the ground with a crash in front of Harry. This indicates Du st's involvement in the action.

relationships.description: Fudge orders Dawlish to take Harry, indicating a relationship between Fudge and Dawlish based on authority.
Fudge also orders Shacklebolt to take Harry, showing another relationship between Fudge and Shacklebolt based on authority.
McGonagall forces Harry out of harm's way, indicating a protective relationship between McGonagall and Harry.
McGonagall also forces Marietta out of harm's way, showing another protective relationship between McGonagall and Marietta.
